snippet: The comptroller candidate, who had been pressured to release the documents, was paid at least $2 million by CNN since 2011 and received over $2.5 million from real estate holdings last year.
abstract: Trailside blog; tax returns released by Eliot Spitzer, candidate for New York City comptroller, show he made at least $2 million after his short-lived stint serving as anchor for CNN; television work supplemented already healthy income that Spitzer receives from real estate holdings that earned him over $2.5 million in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The comptroller candidate, who had been pressured to release the documents, was paid at least $2 million by CNN since 2011 and received over $2.5 million from real estate holdings last year.

headline.main: With Tax Returns, Spitzer Sheds Light on Finances
headline.print_headline:
With Tax Returns, Spitzer
Sheds Light on Finances
